categories.category_description: Single-node queries to retrieve full properties for entities (Person, TikTokUser, YouTubeChannel, TikTokVideo, Area, Municipality, Influencer) for profiling, auditing and sample selection.

Two- and three-node queries that link account nodes to their videos and followers (TikTokUser -> HAS_VIDEO -> TikTokVideo; Person -> FOLLOWS -> Influencer) to measure reach, posting frequency, follower counts and potential influencer exposure for youths.

Queries exploring relationships between videos and topics/tags (YouTubeVideo -[:HAS_TOPIC]-> YoutubeVideoTopic; TikTokVideo -[:HAS_TAG]-> TikTokHashTag) to find which topics or tags youth are exposed to and how often.

Multi-node patterns that find co-occurring hashtags, stickers or tags on the same video (TikTokVideo connected to multiple TikTokHashTag/TikTokSticker) to map content themes and combinations related to unhealthy lifestyles.
Paths that connect Influencer accounts across platforms (Influencer -[:HAS_ACCOUNT]-> TikTokUser and YouTubeChannel) and to Person followers to identify cross-platform reach and bridging actors.

Three-or-more-node queries that trace Person -> FOLLOWS -> Influencer -> HAS_VIDEO -> Tag/Topic to correlate exposure to specific content types with reported health behaviors or outcomes in Person nodes.

Queries combining Person, Area and Municipality (Person -[:LIVES_IN_AREA]-> Area -[:BELONGS_TO]-> Municipality) to aggregate exposure metrics and health indicators by area or municipality to reveal spatial inequalities.

Graph traversal and path queries to identify clusters and communities (followers network, shared tags, shared videos) to find online communities that disproportionately include youths from disadvantaged areas.

Aggregate queries across videos and comments (view_count, like_count, share_count, comment_count) and paths from accounts to videos to compute engagement rates and identify highly viral content reaching youth.
Time-aware queries using video create_time / published_at and comment.create_time to track content emergence, peaks in exposure and how temporal patterns map to reported behaviors in Persons.

Two- and three-node queries examining TikTokVideo -> HAS_COMMENT -> TikTokComment to measure volume, engagement and content of comments as proxies for sentiment and normative cues experienced by youth.

Path queries that trace follower chains and repost/mention relationships (Person -> FOLLOWS -> Influencer -> HAS_VIDEO -> TikTokHashTag) to model likely information diffusion routes into specific communities.

Combined attribute and path queries to find Persons with health-risk indicators (e.g., smoking, drinking) who follow or are exposed to particular content/topics and live in low-income or high-benefit areas.

Multi-hop queries building networks between YoutubeVideoTopic, YoutubeVideoTag, TikTokHashTag and video nodes to detect semantic clusters (e.g., 'fitness' vs 'unhealthy lifestyle') and how those clusters map to youth exposure.
